snippet: The four Republicans who broke with their party on New York’s gay-marriage law were supposedly marked for electoral death. But that’s not exactly how it is working out.
abstract: Bill Keller article explores the experiences of the four Republican New York State senators who broke with their party to vote for the state's gay-marriage law and their electoral prospects in upcoming elections.
lead_paragraph: The four Republicans who broke with their party on New York’s gay-marriage law were supposedly marked for electoral death. But that’s not exactly how it is working out.

headline.seo: The Fate of the Republicans Who Supported Gay Marriage
headline.main: When Is a Flip Not a Flop?
headline.print_headline: When Is A Flip Not A Flop?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
